tn.text: The part of the story from the previous chapter continues. Jesus reclines at the table with his disciples and continues to speak to them.

Here the phrase "fall away" implies to stop putting one's trust in Jesus. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "so that you would not stop trusting in me because of the difficulties you must face." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the hour is coming when everyone who kills you will think that he is offering a service to God
tn.text: "it will someday happen that a person will kill you and think he is doing something good for God."

tn.ref: They will do these things because they have not known the Father nor me
tn.text: They will kill some believers because they do not know God the Father or Jesus.
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])
Here "hour" is a metonym that refers to the time when people will persecute Jesus' followers. AT: "when they cause you to suffer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is a metonym that refers to the first days of Jesus' ministry. AT: "when you first started following me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is an idiom that means the disciples are very sad. AT: "you are now very sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: if I do not go away, the Comforter will not come to you
tn.text: You can translate this in a positive form. AT: "the Comforter will come to you only if I go away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
This is a title for the Holy Spirit who will be with the disciples after Jesus goes away. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:14:25|14:26]].

tn.ref: the Comforter will prove the world to be wrong about sin ... righteousness ... I am going to the Father
tn.text: When the Holy Spirit came, he began to show people that they are sinners.
This refers to the Holy Spirit. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:14:15|14:16]].
This is a metonym that refers to the people in the world.(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: about sin, because they do not believe in me
tn.text: "they are guilty of sin because they do not trust in me"

tn.ref: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father, and you will no longer see me
tn.text: "when I return to God, and they see me no more, they will know that I did the right things"
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: about judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged
tn.text: "God will hold them accountable and will punish them for their sins, just as he will punish Satan, the one who rules this world"
Here "ruler" refers to Satan. AT: "Satan who rules this world." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:12:30|12:31]].
"messages for you" or "words for you"
This is a name for the Holy Spirit who will tell the people the truth about God.

tn.ref: he will guide you into all the truth
tn.text: The "truth" refers to spiritual truth. AT: "he will teach you all the spiritual truth you need to know" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he will say whatever he hears
tn.text: Jesus implies that God the Father will speak to the Spirit. AT: "he will say whatever God tells him to say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he will take from what is mine and he will tell it to you
tn.text: Here "things of mine" refers to Jesus' teaching and mighty works. AT: "he will reveal to you that what I have said and done are indeed true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: the Spirit will take from what is mine and he will tell it to you
tn.text: The Holy Spirit will tell people that the words and works of Jesus are true. AT: "The Holy Spirit will tell everyone that my words and works are true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: In a short amount of time
tn.text: "Soon" or "Before much time passes"

tn.ref: after another short amount of time
tn.text: "again, before much time passes"
There is a break in Jesus' speaking as his disciples ask each other about what Jesus meant.

tn.ref: A short amount of time you will no longer see me
tn.text: The disciples did not understand that this refers to Jesus' death on the cross.

tn.ref: after another short amount of time you will see me
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) This could refer to Jesus' resurrection or 2) This could refer to Jesus' coming at the end of time.
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])
Jesus continues speaking to his disciples.

tn.ref: Is this what you are asking yourselves, what I meant by saying,  ... see me'?
tn.text: Jesus uses this question so his disciples will focus on what he has just told them, so he can explain further. AT: "You are asking yourselves what I meant when I said, ... see me.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Truly, truly, I say to you
tn.text: Translate this the way your language emphasizes that what follows is important and true. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:01:49|1:51]].

tn.ref: but the world will be glad
tn.text: Here the "world" is a metonym for the people who oppose God. AT: "but the people who oppose God will be glad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: but your sorrow will be turned into joy
tn.text: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "but your sadness will turn into joy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This is an idiom that speaks of the heart as if it were a person. AT: "you will be very happy" or "you will be very joyful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: Truly, truly, I say to you
tn.text: Translate this the way your language emphasizes that what follows is important and true. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:01:49|1:51]].

tn.ref: if you ask anything of the Father in my name, he will give it to you
tn.text: Here the word "name" is a metonym that refers to the person and authority of Jesus. AT: "if you ask anything of the Father, he will give it to you because you belong to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

Here "name" is a metonym that refers to the person and authority of Jesus. The Father will honor the requests of the believers because of their relationship with Jesus. AT: "because you are my followers" or "on my authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
You can translate this in an active form. AT: "God will give you great joy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"in language that is not clear"
"it will soon happen"

tn.ref: tell you plainly about the Father
tn.text: "tell you about the Father in a way that you will clearly understand."
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: you will ask in my name
tn.text: Here "name" is a metonym for the person and authority of Jesus. AT: "you will ask because you belong to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the Father himself loves you because you have loved me
tn.text: When a person loves Jesus, the Son, they also love the Father, because the Father and Son are one.
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: I came from the Father ... I am leaving the world and I am going to the Father
tn.text: After his death and resurrection, Jesus will return to God the Father.

tn.ref: I came from the Father ... going to the Father
tn.text: Here "Father" is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])
The "world" is a metonym that refers to the people who live in the world. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The disciples respond to Jesus.

This remarks appears in the form of a question to show that Jesus is puzzled that his disciples are only now ready to trust him. AT: "So, now you finally place your trust in me! (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Jesus continues speaking to his disciples.
You can translate this in an active form. AT: "others will scatter you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: so that you will have peace in me
tn.text: Here "peace" refers to inner peace. AT: "so that you may have inner peace because of your relationship with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Here "the world" refers to the troubles and persecution that believers will endure from those who oppose God. AT: "I have conquered the troubles of this world" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
